Constructor Detail

Anchor

public Anchor(java.lang.String href,
              java.lang.String text,
              java.lang.String target,
              boolean forceProtocol)
Create a new <a tag, with properly escaped contents.

Parameters:
href - the href attribute for the tag.
text - the inner text of this tag. It will have all of its HTML entities escaped automatically.
target - the frame target of the anchor.
forceProtocol - If true, http:// will be prepended if not already existing. This also has the effect of killing malicious "javascript:" links. It's a good idea to make this 'true' when displaying user specified URLs.

Anchor

public Anchor(java.lang.String href,
              java.lang.String text,
              java.lang.String target)
Create a new <a tag, with properly escaped contents.

Parameters:
href - the href attribute for the tag.
text - the inner text of this tag. It will have all of its HTML entities escaped automatically.
target - the frame target of the anchor.

Anchor

public Anchor(java.lang.String href,
              java.lang.String text)
Create a new <a tag, with properly escaped contents.

Parameters:
href - the href attribute for the tag.
text - the inner text of this tag. It will have all of its HTML entities escaped automatically.

Anchor

public Anchor()
Create an empty <a tag.

Method Detail

setHref

public void setHref(java.lang.String href)
Set the href location.

setText

public void setText(java.lang.String text)
Set the inner text. The text will have all of its HTML entities escaped automatically.

setHTML

public void setHTML(java.lang.String html)
Sets this anchor's text as raw HTML. No escaping is done, so be careful.

setFrameTarget

public void setFrameTarget(java.lang.String target)
Sets the frame target for this anchor.
